result.execSummary:
The defendant Kasey D. Stieber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 90 days MCJ with 45 days to start -- no objection to jail being served on EMP - with NO days credit.  State notes parties have agreement that if defendant would NOT qualify for EMP, the parties would come back to Court and request a  probation sentence.  COURT will allow defendant to request modification of sentence if EMP is not available.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kasey D. Stieber

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 1:37 pm 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Def appears in person, pro se. 
VRCW. 
State moves to: 
Ct. 2>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: Ct. 1 (Retail Theft/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, def is competent to represent self, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: 90 days MCJ with 45 days to start - no objection to jail being served on EMP - with NO days credit; CC including DNA surcharge (sample already on file) with 60 days to pay or set up payment. 

State notes parties have agreement that if def would NOT qualify for EMP, the parties would come back to Court and request a probation sentence. 
COURT will allow def to request modification of sentence if EMP is not available. 
Adj: 1:48 pm

Clerk: Amanda. 
Case Called at 1:42 pm.
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig.  Defendant appears, pro se.
VRCW. 

Defendant does not wish to obtain counsel, and is still considering the State's offer. 
Waiver of Right to Attorney form given to defendant; Court directs defendant to bring form back at next hearing. 
Adj: 1:46 pm.

Pre-trial conference on July 14, 2022 at 02:50 pm.
Final pre-trial on July 28, 2022 at 01:35 pm.
Jury status hearing on September 6, 2022 at 01:35 pm.
Jury Trial on September 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.

No contact with victim(s): Walmart in Rib Mountain, WI. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.

Advised Right of Counsel.

CONDITIONS:

- Prints and photograph.
